category: Safety and Health Management Regulations/Article 17 (Safety and Health Education)
contents: Article 17 (Safety and Health Education) ① In order to conduct safety and health education in accordance with Article 29 of the Industrial Safety Act and Article 26 of the Enforcement Rules of the same Act, the Chairman shall establish a safety and health education plan by January 31 of each year, and provide all departments and departments of the headquarters. You must notify the branch office (regional headquarters). Revised December 22, 2021, ② When establishing a safety and health education plan pursuant to paragraph 1, the Chairman of the Board shall ensure that it includes the following contents: 1. Firefighting, gas, and electricity applicable to relevant laws and regulations ·On-the-job training for safety management of office facilities such as elevators, 2. On-the-job training on safety and health conducted by the Minister of Employment and Labor for general management managers, 3. Special training for public servants in the industrial complex facility series, ③ Management supervisors are workers in the relevant department. Safety and health education must be provided. In this case, additional safety and health education can be implemented by establishing an own plan., ④ After conducting safety and health education, the management supervisor measures the training performance through questions and answers, surveys, tests, etc., and the general management manager conducts safety and health education for the following year. The results can be reflected in the education plan., ⑤ Delete, ⑥ Delete
